pattern_sources.author: Shana S. Cohen
pattern_sources.name: Shanalines Designs
pattern_sources.notes:
I am an architect with experience teaching technical and design studio courses in several higher education venues. I bring my experience of geometry and writing design syllabi to my pattern writing. My size-inclusive patterns are mostly modular designs, and mostly garter stitch! In pattern writing, I make legible directions that allow the knitter to customize their own work in the process. I pay attention to maximizing yardage and adaptability of styling in my work. Throughout all of my endeavors, I love connecting with individuals, helping them to become the best version of themselves. I aim to write my patterns in a way to foster this creative expression in you, the knitter. I hope you have fun playing with color and style when working my patterns.

Find out more about me at my website: www.shanalines.com

pattern_sources.author: Laura Gilkey
pattern_sources.name: Geometric Mobius Fidgets
pattern_sources.notes:
*Your purchase is greatly appreciated, but if you need a free copy of this ebook for charity project, feel free to use coupon code "CharityFidgets01".*

Collection of crochet fidget toy patterns in geometric shapes.  Includes seven designs:

* Spiralling Square
* Perpetual Pentagon
* Hypnotic Hexagon
* Oscillating Octagon
* Neverending Nonagon
* Depthless Decagon
* Dancing Dodecagon

Each shape has been given its own page. You can use your print menu to print only the pages for the shapes you want.

The edge of each toy can be endlessly pulled out from the center as a tool for focusing attention or calming restless nerves. Makes a great stashbuster, gift, or charity project. The geometric shapes take a bit more counting than other crochet mobius fidgets, but are still very simple.

Can be made in any desired gauge. Examples use worsted weight (#4 Medium) yarn and size I (5.5mm) crochet hook.

Materials;
Any desired yarn
Matching crochet hook
Stitch Marker
Scissors
Yarn needle

Stitches used:
ch - chain
sc - single crochet
sl st - slip stitch

Many thanks to Penny, Donna, and Lois of Lake Area Fiber Arts Guild - [https://www.lakefiberarts.com/][1]
And to the designers behind the following tutorials:
Lisa of less-waste.co.uk: “Hyperbolic Mobius” - [https://www.less-waste.co.uk/yarn-scrap-hyperbolic-mobius/][2]
Maak het met Miranda - Made with Miranda Workshops at Youtube: “Miranda’s Magic Fidget” - [https://youtu.be/w4uzQqsrjrI][3]

Designer’s Note: You may sell items you make from this pattern or do whatever else you like with them. You may also use this pattern to teach classes and distribute copies to the students. Otherwise, please do not redistribute the pattern itself; please link to the source.


  [1]: https://www.lakefiberarts.com/
  [2]: https://www.less-waste.co.uk/yarn-scrap-hyperbolic-mobius/
  [3]: https://youtu.be/w4uzQqsrjrI

pattern_sources.author: Hortense
pattern_sources.name: Knitting with Chopsticks
pattern_sources.notes:
Find easy, modern knitting and crochet patterns for women, home and babies. Perfect for crafting while watching your favorite show!

*Buy 2 or more patterns, get 30% off your entire order: use code BUNDLE30 at checkout*

Sick of all the yarn jargon, abbreviations and conversions? Grab your free yarn jargon cheatsheets here: https://programs.knittingwithchopsticks.com/cheatsheets

Social Media:
Instagram: https://instagram.com/knittingwithchopsticks
Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/knittingwithchopsticks/
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/knittingwithchopsticks/

For details of the Erika Knight yarn collection along with local stockists and wholesale information please visit [our website.][1]

For more information and news about Erika's designs, books and events please follow @knightkraft on Instagram, Facebook and Twitter or visit [her website][2].

pattern_sources.author: Laura Gilkey
pattern_sources.name: Geometric Mobius Fidgets
pattern_sources.notes:
*Your purchase is greatly appreciated, but if you need a free copy of this ebook for charity project, feel free to use coupon code "CharityFidgets01".*

Collection of crochet fidget toy patterns in geometric shapes.  Includes seven designs:

* Spiralling Square
* Perpetual Pentagon
* Hypnotic Hexagon
* Oscillating Octagon
* Neverending Nonagon
* Depthless Decagon
* Dancing Dodecagon

Each shape has been given its own page. You can use your print menu to print only the pages for the shapes you want.

The edge of each toy can be endlessly pulled out from the center as a tool for focusing attention or calming restless nerves. Makes a great stashbuster, gift, or charity project. The geometric shapes take a bit more counting than other crochet mobius fidgets, but are still very simple.

Can be made in any desired gauge. Examples use worsted weight (#4 Medium) yarn and size I (5.5mm) crochet hook.

Materials;
Any desired yarn
Matching crochet hook
Stitch Marker
Scissors
Yarn needle

Stitches used:
ch - chain
sc - single crochet
sl st - slip stitch

Many thanks to Penny, Donna, and Lois of Lake Area Fiber Arts Guild - [https://www.lakefiberarts.com/][1]
And to the designers behind the following tutorials:
Lisa of less-waste.co.uk: “Hyperbolic Mobius” - [https://www.less-waste.co.uk/yarn-scrap-hyperbolic-mobius/][2]
Maak het met Miranda - Made with Miranda Workshops at Youtube: “Miranda’s Magic Fidget” - [https://youtu.be/w4uzQqsrjrI][3]

Designer’s Note: You may sell items you make from this pattern or do whatever else you like with them. You may also use this pattern to teach classes and distribute copies to the students. Otherwise, please do not redistribute the pattern itself; please link to the source.


  [1]: https://www.lakefiberarts.com/
  [2]: https://www.less-waste.co.uk/yarn-scrap-hyperbolic-mobius/
  [3]: https://youtu.be/w4uzQqsrjrI
